stanza.line: No Time thou shalt not boast that I do changechange
Thy pyramids built up with newer mightmight
To me are nothing novel nothing strangestrange
They are but dressings Of a former sightsight
Our dates are brief and therefore we admireadmire
What thou dost foist upon us that is oldold
And rather make them born to our desiredesire
Than think that we before have heard them toldtold
Thy registers and thee I both defydefy
Not wondring at the present nor the pastpast
For thy records and what we see doth lielie
Made more or less by thy continual hastehaste
This I do vow and this shall ever bebe
I will be true despite thy scythe and theethee
